methods.name: getAnimatedProperty

returnValue.description:
An object with the following properties:
  • For Translate, Rotate, Scale:
    • offsetToRest: float[] - translation, scale or rotation in quaternion form relative to the values of the rest transformation. If the property is not defined, null is assigned.
    • offsetToPrevious: float[] - translation, scale or rotation relative to the values at the end of the previous playback or the values of the rest transformation for the first playback. If the property is not defined, null is assigned. Rotation is assigned in the form in which the animation track is defined.
    • absolute: float[] - values of translation, scale or rotation in quaternion form in the parent's coordinate space.
    • world: float[] - values of translation, scale or rotation in quaternion form in the world coordinate space.
  • For Opacity:
    • offsetToRest: float - opacity relative to the rest opacity. If the property is not defined, null is assigned.
    • offsetToPrevious: float - opacity relative to the value at the end of the previous playback or the rest opacity for the first playback. If the property is not defined, null is assigned.
    • opacity: float - the node's own opacity
    • totalOpacity: float - the product of opacity values from all the ancestors and the node's own opacity.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.Annotation
symbols.description: Annotation allows applications to display custom html annotation on top of Viewport and associate it with 3D object

experimental.text: This class is experimental and might be modified or removed in future versions.

properties.name: annotationId
properties.description: Reference to the annotation Id

properties.name: name
properties.description: Reference to the annotation name

properties.name: nodeRef
properties.description: Reference to the node that represents the annotation

properties.name: text
properties.description: The text that will be displayed in the annotation

properties.name: style
properties.description: The style of the annotation

properties.name: display
properties.description: Controls the visibility of the annotation

properties.name: animate
properties.description: Controls the animation of the annotation. If set to false then animation is not played.

properties.name: animationDelay
properties.description: Amount of time in seconds to wait before animation is played. Default value of -1 means that this is not set.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Controls the annotation selected state

properties.name: editable
properties.description: If annotation is editable then double click event is fired when user double clicks on the annotation and text editing is allowed by calling openEditor() method. If annotation is also selected then resize and reposition handles will be displayed.

properties.name: xCoordinate
properties.description: Sets the X Coordinate of the annotation. This uses a scale of -0.5 to 0.5, left to right respectively. This is relative to the Viewport's safe area if present, otherwise it is relative to the Viewport.

properties.name: yCoordinate
properties.description: Sets the Y Coordinate of the annotation. This uses a scale of -0.5 to 0.5, top to bottom respectively. This is relative to the Viewport's safe area if present, otherwise it is relative to the Viewport.

properties.name: xOffset
properties.description: Sets horizontal offset of annotation's position relative to the point where it should be normally placed. Can be used to offset annotation from attachment node (if set). This uses a scale of -0.5 to 0.5, left to right respectively.

properties.name: yOffset
properties.description: Sets horizontal offset of annotation's position relative to the point where it should be normally placed. Can be used to offset annotation from attachment node (if set). This uses a scale of -0.5 to 0.5, top to bottom respectively.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Sets the height of the annotation. This uses a scale of 0 to 1, 0% to 100% respectively. This is relative to the Viewport's safe area if present, otherwise it is relative to the Viewport. Negative values will be ignored.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Sets the width of the annotation. This uses a scale of 0 to 1, 0% to 100% respectively. This is relative to the Viewport's safe area if present, otherwise it is relative to the Viewport. Negative values will be ignored.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.AuthorizationHandler
sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy
symbols.description:
Provides a simple, lightweight proxy object to a node in a node hierarchy. The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created through the use of the following methods:
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#enumerateChildren sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateChildren}
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#enumerateAncestors sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateAncestors}
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager#enumerateSelection sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager.enumerateSelection}

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new BaseNodeProxy. The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created through the use of the following methods:
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#enumerateChildren sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateChildren}
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#enumerateAncestors sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateAncestors}
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager#enumerateSelection sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager.enumerateSelection}
Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.base.Object#constructor sap.ui.base.Object} can be used.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.CameraFOVBindingType
symbols.description: Camera field of view binding types.

properties.name: Horizontal
properties.description: The field of view is bound to the width of the viewport.

properties.name: Maximum
properties.description: The field of view is bound to the width or the height of the viewport, whichever is bigger.

properties.name: Minimum
properties.description: The field of view is bound to the width or the height of the viewport, whichever is smaller.

properties.name: Vertical
properties.description: The field of view is bound to the height of the viewport.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector
symbols.description: Provides an object that owns content resources, tracks their changes and loads and destroys the content built from the content resources.

aggregations.name: contentResources
aggregations.description: Content resources to load and display.

aggregations.name: viewStateManagers
aggregations.description: View state managers.

aggregations.name: defaultViewStateManager
aggregations.description:
Default view state manager.

The default view state manager is used when no explicit view state manager is assigned to objects that require a view state manager.

aggregations.name: contentManagers
aggregations.description: Content managers.

events.name: contentChangesStarted
events.description: This event will be fired when content resource changes are about to be processed.

events.name: contentChangesFinished
events.description: This event will be fired when any content resource or the contentResources aggregation has been changed and processed.

content.name: content
content.description:
The content created or updated.

The content can be of type HTMLImageElement, sap.ui.vk.Scene etc.

failureReason.name: failureReason
failureReason.description:
The failure reason if any.
An single element or an array of elements with the following structure:
  • error - An object with details of the error.
  • contentResource - A {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentResource sap.ui.vk.ContentResource} object when it is possible to match the Error object to a {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentResource sap.ui.vk.ContentResource} object.

events.name: contentChangesProgress
events.description: This event will be fired to report the progress of content changes.

phase.name: phase
phase.description: The name of the loading phase. It can be e.g. 'downloading', 'building the scene' etc. It might be null if reporting this parameter does not make sense.

percentage.name: percentage
percentage.description: The overall percentage of the loading process.

source.name: source
source.description: The content resource currently being loaded. It might be null if reporting this parameter does not make sense.

events.name: contentLoadingFinished
events.description: This event will be fired when content loading is finished.

events.name: contentReplaced
events.description: This event will be fired when the current content is completely rebuilt or destroyed as a result of changes in content resources.

newContent.name: newContent
newContent.description:
New content.

The content can be of type HTMLImageElement, sap.ui.vk.Scene etc.

oldContent.name: oldContent
oldContent.description:
Old content.

The content can be of type HTMLImageElement, sap.ui.vk.Scene etc.

events.name: contentDestroying
events.description: This event will be fired when the current content is about to be destroyed.

content.name: content
content.description:
The content to be destroyed.

The content can be of type HTMLImageElement, sap.ui.vk.Scene etc.

preventGarbageCollection.name: preventGarbageCollection
preventGarbageCollection.description: Returns a function(prevent: boolean) with one boolean parameter. To prevent garbage collection after the content is destroyed call this function passing true as a parameter.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new ContentConnector object. Generated automatically if no ID is given.

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new ContentConnector object.

constructor.description: Constructor for a new ContentConnector. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: contentChangesFinished

content.name: content
content.description:

failureReason.name: failureReason

An single element or an array of elements with the following structure:
  • error - An object with details of the error.
  • contentResource - A {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentResource sap.ui.vk.ContentResource} object when it is possible to match the Error object to a {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentResource sap.ui.vk.ContentResource} object.

methods.name: addContentManagerResolver

returnValue.description: The {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector} class to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: resolver

pattern.name: pattern
pattern.description: The pattern the {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentResource#getSourceType sourceType} property of the content resource is compared with.

dimension.name: dimension
dimension.description: Dimension of models of this source type. E.g. 2 or 3.

contentManagerClassName.name: contentManagerClassName
contentManagerClassName.description: Name of the content manager class to use for loading content resources of this type. E.g. sap.ui.vk.dvl.ContentManager, sap.ui.vk.threejs.ContentManager, sap.ui.vk.ImageContentManager.

settings.name: settings
settings.description: Optional settings specific to the content manager class.

parameters.description:
Object that defines how to find out the content manager class name.
If resolver is a function then this function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentResource sap.ui.vk.ContentResource} and returns a {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise Promise} that resolves with an object with the following properties:
  • dimension: int - dimension of the model. E.g. 2 or 3.
  • contentManagerClassName: string - name of content manager class to use for loading the content resource.
  • settings: object - optional settings specific to the content manager.
    See {@link sap.ui.vk.threejs.ContentManager sap.ui.vk.threejs.ContentManager}.
If resolver is an object then it has the following properties:

methods.description:
Adds a new content manager resolver.

The last added resolver will be executed the first.

Content manager resolver analyzes the content resource definition and returns the type of the content manager to use for loading the content resource.

The simplest resolver tests the content resource source type. The test can be either a string comparison or a regular expression.

A more sophisticated resolver is a function that can use the full content resource definition to find a proper content manager dynamically, e.g. the resolver can use the 'HEAD' HTTP request to get the 'Content-Type' header to find out the type of the content resource.

examples.caption: Add a new content manager resolver based on string comparison of the sourceType property of the content resource.
Add a new content manager resolver based on regular expression test of the sourceType property of the content resource.
Add a new content manager resolver that makes a 'HEAD' HTTP request and checks the Content-Type header.
Add a new content manager resolver to load content resources with three.js objects.

methods.name: setRetryCount

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: retryCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of retry attempts. Value must be non-negative. The default retry count is 1, unless specified otherwise by calling this method and passing in the desired value. Passing in 0 disables any retry attempts.

methods.description:
Sets the maximum number of retry attempts for a download operation if the initial request to retrieve a model from a remote server could not be fulfilled and the error with which the request failed is considered recoverable.

Retry Mechanism

Requests to retrieve (download) a model from a remote server may not always be fulfilled. If the request failed with an error that is considered recoverable then the download manager will keep on trying issuing new requests until the request is fulfilled or the specified retryCount is exceeded. The default number of retry attempts is 1, unless specified otherwise by calling this method. Note that, specifying 0 as retryCount disables the retry mechanism altogether. Timing of retry attempts: There is no delay between subsequent attempts. Events fired: The download manager will not fire any events between subsequent attempts. For each requested item there will be a single itemSucceeded or itemFailed event fired when the download operation for that given item finishes. Recoverable errors: The following errors are considered recoverable:
  • Any kind of network error (e.g. due to temporary network outage). HTTP status code is expected to be 0.
  • Responses with the following 4xx-5xx HTTP status codes:
    • 408: Request Timeout
    • 425: Too Early (RFC 8470)
    • 429: Too Many Requests (RFC 6585)
    • 500: Internal Server Error
    • 502: Bad Gateway
    • 503: Service Unavailable
    • 504: Gateway Timeout

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.description: The consumption scenario.

methods.description: Set the consumption scenario for metering differention. This value is passed in SAP-ConsumptionScenario HTTP headers in requests made to the EPD Visualization backend when viewing.

methods.name: setRetryCount

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: retryCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of retry attempts. Value must be non-negative. The default number of retry attempts is 1, unless specified otherwise by calling this method and passing in the desired value. Specifying 0 disables any retry attempts.

methods.description:
Sets the maximum number of retry attempts for a download operation if the initial request to retrieve a model from a remote server could not be fulfilled and the error with which the request failed is considered recoverable.

See {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector#setRetryCount} for details.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.ContentResource
symbols.description: Specifies a resource to load.

properties.name: source
properties.description: The source URL or the {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/File File} object of the content resource/file to load from. The source may be omitted if a grouping node is needed.

properties.name: sourceType
properties.description:
The source type of the content resource. Valid types:
  • vds
  • vds4
  • svg
  • png
  • jpg
  • jpeg
  • gif
  • bmp
  • tif*
  • tiff*
  • stream
The source type may be omitted if this is a grouping content node.
NOTE: The tif and tiff image formats are not supported on all browsers. Source type "vds" initializes deprecated DVL namespace and uses legacy library to load and display VDS file content. If source type of "vds4" is used then new namespace based on Threejs rendering model will be used to load and display VDS file content. Since DVL namespace is deprecated in one of future releases it will be removed and source type "vds" will also use Threejs model.

properties.name: sourceId
properties.description: The unique ID of the content resource.

properties.name: localMatrix
properties.description: The local transformation matrix of the node created for this content resource.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the node created for this content resource.

properties.name: password
properties.description: The password to use when opening the resource.

properties.name: useSecureConnection
properties.description: If set to false, unsecure connections will be used. Default: true.

properties.name: veid
properties.description: Id of scene to retrieve tree for. Mandatory for the stream source type.

properties.name: includeHidden
properties.description: Send structural data for hidden objects, if false they will be omitted, reducing data size. Default: true.

properties.name: includeAnimation
properties.description: Send structural data for animation objects, if false they will be omitted, reducing data size. Default: true.

properties.name: pushPMI
properties.description: If set to true, elements for PMI rendering content will be returned. Default: false.

properties.name: metadataFilter
properties.description: Optional metadata filter that can trim the tree before sending to the client only keeping nodes that passed the filter and their parents. Default: null. Format: Comma-separated list of meta.category1.tag1.value1, meta.category2.tag2.value2. "meta." is the prefix and all metadata filters must start with it. Multiple filters are supported, they are combined using `OR` operator. Includes parent nodes of matching nodes (e.g. breadcrumb) even if they don't pass the filter.

properties.name: activateView
properties.description: Optional parameter with view id which shall be activated when scene is loaded.

properties.name: enableLogger
properties.description: Optional boolean parameter to enable detailed logging. Can be used to track performance issues during data streaming from SAP 3D Visualization Service.

properties.name: pushViewGroups
properties.description: If set to true, information of view groups will be returned. Default: true.

properties.name: includeBackground
properties.description: If set to true, will return nodes with the type background

properties.name: includeParametric
properties.description: If set to true, will load parametric nodes

properties.name: includeUsageId
properties.description:
Optional parameter to load UsageIds. Valid values:
  • true - Load all UsageIds. This is potentially very expensive, as there could be many UsageIds defined for the tenant which are not relevant to the current application.
  • false - Do not load any UsageIds.
  • string - A single non-empty string which defines the name of the requested UsageId.
  • string[] - An array of non-empty strings which define the names of requested UsageIds.

properties.name: dependencyLoader
properties.description: An object used to load content resource's dependencies. A content resource may have dependencies, e.g. if the loaded content resource is a shattered VDS file it reference other VDS files. dependencyLoader should be an object with method function load(uri: string, context: any): Promise<{buffer: ArrayBuffer, context: any}>, where uri is a reference to a dependency and context is opaque data. uri is application specific and can be a full URL or a relative file name or anything else, e.g. some identifier known to dependencyLoader.

aggregations.name: contentResources
aggregations.description: Child content resources.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID of the new content resource. sIdis generated automatically if no non-empty ID is given. Note: this can be omitted, regardless of whether mSettings will be provided or not.

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: An optional map/JSON object with initial property values, aggregated objects etc. for the new content resource.

parameters.name: oScope
parameters.description: scope An object for resolving string-based type and formatter references in bindings.

constructor.description: Constructor for a new ContentResource. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.description:
Gets content resource source properties. The content resource source properties depend on the content resource source type. They are different for VDS and PNG for example. The list of possible source properties:
  • version - object
    • major - number
    • minor - number
  • compressed - boolean
  • encrypted - boolean
The source properties are optional and the list might be extended in future versions.

methods.name: decrypt

returnValue.description: The decrypted buffer.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The derived key generated by the previous call to {@link sap.ui.vk.DecryptionHandler#deriveKey sap.ui.vk.DecryptionHandler.deriveKey}.

parameters.name: iv
parameters.description: The 128-bit {@link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Initialization_vector initialization vector}.

parameters.name: encryptedData
parameters.description: The encrypted buffer.

methods.description: Decrypts the input buffer with the {@link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Advanced_Encryption_Standard AES128} algorithm in the {@link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Block_cipher_mode_of_operation#Cipher_Block_Chaining_.28CBC.29 CBC} mode.

methods.name: deriveKey

returnValue.description: A derived 128-bit key that should be passed to subsequent calls to {@link sap.ui.vk.DecryptionHandler#decrypt sap.ui.vk.DecryptionHandler.decrypt}.

parameters.name: salt
parameters.description: Random data that is used as an additional input to a one-way function that "hashes" a password or passphrase.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: A password used for encryption/decryption.

methods.description:
Generates a cryptographic session key derived from a base data value.

The key must be derived with the {@link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PBKDF2 PBKDF2} algorithm by applying the {@link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hash-based_message_authentication_code HMAC}-{@link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SHA-2 SHA256} function 10,000 times.

The resulting 128-bit key should be passed to subsequent calls to {@link sap.ui.vk.DecryptionHandler#decrypt sap.ui.vk.DecryptionHandler.decrypt}.

symbols.description:
Provides a simple, lightweight proxy object to a node in a node hierarchy. The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created through the use of the following methods:
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#enumerateChildren sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateChildren}
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#enumerateAncestors sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateAncestors}
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager#enumerateSelection sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager.enumerateSelection}

Constructor for a new BaseNodeProxy. The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created through the use of the following methods:
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#enumerateChildren sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateChildren}
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#enumerateAncestors sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateAncestors}
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager#enumerateSelection sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager.enumerateSelection}
Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy#constructor sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy} can be used.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.dvl.LayerProxy
symbols.description:
Provides a proxy object to the layer in the node hierarchy.

Layer is a list of nodes. One node hierarchy can have multiple layers. One node can be included in multiple layers.

Objects of this type should only be created with the {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#createLayerProxy sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.createLayerProxy} method and destroyed with the {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#destroyLayerProxy sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.destroyLayerProxy} method.

parameters.description: The node proxy object.

methods.description: Destroys the node proxy object.

methods.name: enumerateAncestors

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: nodeRef
parameters.description: The node reference whose ancestor nodes we want enumerated.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function to call when the ancestor nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.dvl.BaseNodeProxy}, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.

parameters.name: passNodeRef
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to pass the node references of the ancestor nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the node references of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.

methods.description:
Enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node in the Scene object. This method enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function, to which it passes the ancestor nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to callback are temporary objects, they are reset after each call to the callback function.
The ancestor nodes are enumerated starting from the top level node, and progresses down the node hierarchy.

methods.name: enumerateChildren

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: nodeRef
parameters.description:
The node reference whose child nodes we want enumerated.
When nodeRef is specified, the child nodes of this node are enumerated.
When no nodeRef is specified, only the top level nodes are enumerated.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function to call when the child nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.dvl.BaseNodeProxy}, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.

parameters.name: stepIntoClosedNodes
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to enumerate the child nodes if the node is closed.
If true, the children of that closed node will be enumerated
If false, the children of that node will not be enumerated

parameters.name: passNodeRef
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to pass the node references of the child nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the node references of the child nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies created from the child node references are passed to the callback function.

methods.description:
Enumerates the child nodes of a particular node in the Scene object. This method gets the child nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function to which it passes the child nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to the callback function are temporary objects, which are reset after each call to the callback function.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.IncludeUsageIdType
symbols.description:
This type defines possible valid values for property {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentResource#getIncludeUsageId ContentResource.includeUsageId}. The possible valid values:
  • true - Load all UsageIds. This is potentially very expensive, as there could be many UsageIds defined for the tenant which are not relevant to the current application.
  • false - Do not load any UsageIds.
  • string - A single non-empty string which defines the name of the requested UsageId.
  • string[] - An array of non-empty strings which define the names of requested UsageIds.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.LayerProxy
symbols.description:
Provides a proxy object to the layer in the node hierarchy.

Layer is a list of nodes. One node hierarchy can have multiple layers. One node can be included in multiple layers.

Objects of this type should only be created with the {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#createLayerProxy sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.createLayerProxy} method and destroyed with the {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#destroyLayerProxy sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.destroyLayerProxy} method.

Objects of this type should only be created with the {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#createLayerProxy sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.createLayerProxy} method and destroyed with the {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#destroyLayerProxy sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.destroyLayerProxy} method. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.base.Object#constructor sap.ui.base.Object} can be used.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy
symbols.description:
Provides the ability to explore a Scene object's node structure.

The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created via a call to {@link sap.ui.vk.Scene#getDefaultNodeHierarchy sap.ui.vk.Scene.getDefaultNodeHierarchy}.

methods.name: enumerateAncestors

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: nodeRef
parameters.description: The reference object of a node whose ancestor nodes we want enumerated.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function to call when the ancestor nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy}, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.

parameters.name: passNodeRef
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to pass the reference objects of the ancestor nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the reference objects of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.

methods.description:
Enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node in the Scene object. This method enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function, to which it passes the ancestor nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to callback are temporary objects, they are reset after each call to the callback function.
The ancestor nodes are enumerated starting from the top level node, and progresses down the node hierarchy.

methods.name: enumerateChildren

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: nodeRef
parameters.description:
The reference object of a node whose child nodes we want enumerated.
When nodeRef is specified, the child nodes of this node are enumerated.
When no nodeRef is specified, only the top level nodes are enumerated.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function to call when the child nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy}, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.

parameters.name: stepIntoClosedNodes
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to enumerate the child nodes if the node is closed.
If true, the children of that closed node will be enumerated
If false, the children of that node will not be enumerated

parameters.name: passNodeRef
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to pass the reference objects of the child nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the reference objects of the child nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies created from the child reference objects are passed to the callback function.

methods.description:
Enumerates the child nodes of a particular node in the Scene object. This method gets the child nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function to which it passes the child nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to the callback function are temporary objects, which are reset after each call to the callback function.

methods.name: findNodesById

returnValue.description: A list of reference objects belonging to nodes that matched the VE IDs search criteria.

parameters.name: query

methods.description: Searches for VE IDs, and returns a list of reference objects of nodes with VE IDs matching the search. The query is run specifically against VE ID structures, which are strictly related to VDS4 models.

methods.name: findNodesByMetadata

returnValue.description: A list of reference objects belonging to nodes that matched the search criteria.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
JSON object containing the search parameters.
The following example shows what the structure of the query object should look like: 
query = {
  category: string,
  key: string,
  value: string | string[],
  predicate: "equals" | "contains" | "startsWith",
  caseSensitive: true | false
}

NOTE: query.predicate and query.caseSensitive refer to query.value.
  • query.category
    A string indicating the name of the metadata category.
    If no value is specified for query.category, all nodes in the scene will be returned in the search.

  • query.key
    A string indicating the key which belongs to the metadata category specified in query.category. You can only use query.key if query.category has been specified.
    If no value is specified for query.key, then all nodes grouped under the specified category will be returned in the search.

  • query.value
    A string or an array of strings containing the value or values associated with query.key. You can only use query.value in the search if query.key has been specified.
    If no value is specified for query.value, then all nodes containing the specified key will be returned, regardless of what the value of the key is.
    The following example shows a single string being passed in: 
    value: "Box #14"
    The following example shows an array of strings being passed in: 
    value: ["Box #3", "box #4", "BOX #5"]
  • query.predicate
    Represents a search mode. The available search modes are "equals", "contains", and "startsWith".
    Using "equals" will search for key values that exactly match the provided string or array of strings.
    Using "contains" will search for key values containing all or part of the provided string or array of strings.
    Using "startsWith" will search key values starting with the provided string or array of strings.
    If no value is specified, the search mode will default to "equals".

  • query.caseSensitive
    Indicates whether the search should be case sensitive or not.
    If true, the search will be case sensitive, and false indicates otherwise.
    If no value is specified, caseSensitive will default to false (that is, the search will be a case-insensitive search).

methods.description: Finds nodes in a scene via metadata information.

returnValue.description: A list of reference objects belonging to nodes that matched the search criteria.

methods.description: Finds nodes in a scene via node name.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.OverlayArea
symbols.description: Aggregation element for the Overlay Control

properties.name: key
properties.description: Unique identifier for the object. This is optional. If not provided the default identifier sId is used. However, sId is generated if template binding is used and thus it is not stable. Provide the key if the object really needs a unique and stable identifier.

properties.name: position
properties.description: The position array for the OverlayArea. The format is "x0;y0;0;...;xN,yN,0".

properties.name: color
properties.description: The fill color of the OverlayArea.

properties.name: colorBorder
properties.description: The border color of the OverlayArea.

properties.name: colorSelect
properties.description: The select color of the OverlayArea in case selection highlighting is desired.

properties.name: colorNonSelect
properties.description: The non-select color of the OverlayArea in case non-selection de-highlighting is desired.

properties.name: deltaColorHot
properties.description: Color or color delta when object is hovered. Color deltas can be declared in the format RHLSA(<hue shift in degree>;<lightness multiplier>;<saturation multiplier>;<opacity multiplier>)

properties.name: select
properties.description: set to true if the element is selected

properties.name: changeable
properties.description: Set to true if OverlayArea is changeable.

events.name: click
events.description: The event is raised when there is a click action on an OverlayArea.

events.name: contextMenu
events.description: The event is raised when there is a right click or a tap and hold action on an OverlayArea.

events.name: edgeClick
events.description: This event is raised when the edge of an OverlayArea is clicked.

index.name: index
index.description: Index of the clicked edge. The numbering is zero based and the first edge with index 0 starts at the first position in the position array and end at the second.

events.name: edgeContextMenu
events.description: This event is raised when the edge of an OverlayArea is right clicked.

symbols.description: Enables capabilities for navigating and activating procedures and steps contained in a single 3D scene.

properties.description: Managed settings and properties for Step Navigation events.

properties.description: Width of the Step Navigation control.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Height of the Step Navigation control.

properties.name: showThumbnails
properties.description: Indicates that the Step Navigation control should display thumbnails. If set to true, then thumbnails are rendered. If set to false, then thumbnails are hidden.

properties.name: showToolbar
properties.description: Indicates that the Step Navigation control should display a toolbar. If set to true, then the toolbar is rendered. If set to false, then the toolbar is hidden.

properties.name: showStepInfo
properties.description: Indicates that the Step Navigation control should display a popup containing information around the step that is playing. If set to true, then the popup is rendered. If set to false, the popup is hidden.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.svg.BaseNodeProxy
symbols.description:
Provides a simple, lightweight proxy object to a node in a node hierarchy. The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created through the use of the following methods:
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#enumerateChildren sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateChildren}
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#enumerateAncestors sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateAncestors}
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager#enumerateSelection sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager.enumerateSelection}

Constructor for a new BaseNodeProxy. The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created through the use of the following methods:
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#enumerateChildren sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateChildren}
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#enumerateAncestors sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateAncestors}
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager#enumerateSelection sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager.enumerateSelection}
Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy#constructor sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy} can be used.

methods.name: enumerateAncestors

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: nodeRef
parameters.description: The reference object of a node whose ancestor nodes we want enumerated.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function to call when the ancestor nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy}, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.

parameters.name: passNodeRef
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to pass the node references of the ancestor nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the node references of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.

methods.description:
Enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node in the Scene object. This method enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function, to which it passes the ancestor nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to callback are temporary objects, they are reset after each call to the callback function.
The ancestor nodes are enumerated starting from the top level node, and progresses down the node hierarchy.

methods.name: enumerateChildren

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: nodeRef
parameters.description:
The reference object of a node whose child nodes we want enumerated.
When nodeRef is specified, the child nodes of this node are enumerated.
When no nodeRef is specified, only the top level nodes are enumerated.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function to call when the child nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy}, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.

parameters.name: stepIntoClosedNodes
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to enumerate the child nodes if the node is closed.
If true, the children of that closed node will be enumerated
If false, the children of that node will not be enumerated

parameters.name: passNodeRef
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to pass the node references of the child nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the node references of the child nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies created from the child node references are passed to the callback function.

methods.description:
Enumerates the child nodes of a particular node in the Scene object. This method gets the child nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function to which it passes the child nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to the callback function are temporary objects, which are reset after each call to the callback function.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.threejs.BaseNodeProxy
symbols.description:
Provides a simple, lightweight proxy object to a node in a node hierarchy. The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created through the use of the following methods:
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#enumerateChildren sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateChildren}
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#enumerateAncestors sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateAncestors}
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager#enumerateSelection sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager.enumerateSelection}

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new BaseNodeProxy. The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created through the use of the following methods:
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#enumerateChildren sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateChildren}
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#enumerateAncestors sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateAncestors}
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager#enumerateSelection sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager.enumerateSelection}
Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy#constructor sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy} can be used.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.threejs.ContentManager
symbols.description:
Provides a content manager object that uses the three.js library to load 3D files. When registering a content manager resolver with {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector.addContentManagerResolver sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector.addContentManagerResolver} you can pass a function that will load a model and merge it into the three.js scene. The loader function takes two parameters:
  • parentNode - {@link https://threejs.org/docs/index.html#api/objects/Group THREE.Group} - a grouping node to merge the content into
  • contentResource - {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentResource sap.ui.vk.ContentResource} - a content resource to load
The loader function returns a {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise Promise} object. If the loading the model succeeds the promise object resolves with a value with the following structure:
  • node - {@link https://threejs.org/docs/index.html#api/objects/Group THREE.Group} - the grouping node to which the content is merged into. It should be the parentNode parameter that was passed to the loader function.
  • contentResource - {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentResource sap.ui.vk.ContentResource} - the content resource that was loaded.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new ContentManager object. Generated automatically if no ID is given.

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new ContentManager object.

constructor.description: Constructor for a new ContentManager. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentManager#constructor sap.ui.vk.ContentManager} can be used.

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: nodeRef
parameters.description: The reference object of a node whose ancestor nodes we want enumerated.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function to call when the ancestor nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy}, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.

parameters.name: passNodeRef
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to pass the node references of the ancestor nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the node references of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.

methods.description:
Enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node in the Scene object. This method enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function, to which it passes the ancestor nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to callback are temporary objects, they are reset after each call to the callback function.
The ancestor nodes are enumerated starting from the top level node, and progresses down the node hierarchy.

methods.name: enumerateChildren

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: nodeRef
parameters.description:
The reference object of a node whose child nodes we want enumerated.
When nodeRef is specified, the child nodes of this node are enumerated.
When no nodeRef is specified, only the top level nodes are enumerated.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function to call when the child nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy}, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.

parameters.name: stepIntoClosedNodes
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to enumerate the child nodes if the node is closed.
If true, the children of that closed node will be enumerated
If false, the children of that node will not be enumerated

parameters.name: passNodeRef
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to pass the node references of the child nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the node references of the child nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies created from the child node references are passed to the callback function.

methods.description:
Enumerates the child nodes of a particular node in the Scene object. This method gets the child nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function to which it passes the child nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to the callback function are temporary objects, which are reset after each call to the callback function.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.ToggleMenuButton
symbols.description: Enables users to trigger actions.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Defines the type of the button (for example, Default, Accept, Reject, Transparent). Values Back, Up and Unstyled are ignored.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the width of the button.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Boolean property to enable the control (default is true). Note: Depending on custom settings, the buttons that are disabled have other colors than the enabled ones.

properties.name: iconDensityAware
properties.description: When set to truefalse to avoid the attempt of fetching density perfect image.

properties.name: menuPosition
properties.description: Specifies the position of the popup menu with enumerated options. By default, the control opens the menu at its bottom left side. Note: In the case that the menu has no space to show itself in the view port of the current window it tries to open itself to the inverted direction.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: This property specifies the element's text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

properties.name: pressed
properties.description: The property is “true” when the control is toggled. The default state of this property is "false".

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: Defines the menu items contained within this control.

associations.name: defaultItem
associations.description: Sets or retrieves the selected item from the aggregation named items.

associations.name: ariaDescribedBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs, which describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs, which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

properties.name: enableStepping
properties.description: If set to true values will change in round number increments instead of continual change

properties.name: enableSnapping
properties.description: Determines if snapping when rotating is enabled

properties.name: showEditingUI
properties.description: Display text box with current value, which can also be used to directly modify the value

properties.name: allowContextMenu
properties.description: Whether or not to allow context menu on right-click

properties.name: nodeSet
properties.description: Determine what set of nodes will be transformed with this tool

events.name: rotating
events.description:
This event will be fired when rotation finished. This event contains parameter 'nodesProperties' that is array of objects, each object has five properties:
  • node: any - A node reference.
  • angle: float - An angle of rotation about the axis.
  • azimuth: float - An azimuth of the axis of rotation in degrees in the parent's space.
  • elevation: float - An elevation of the axis of rotation in degrees in the parent's space.
  • axis: float[] - An axis of rotation in cartesian coordinates in the parent's space.
An axis of rotation in animation keys is stored in cartesian coordinates, in UI an axis of rotation is displayed in polar coordinates using azimuth and elevation.

events.name: rotated
events.description:
This event will be fired when rotation finished. This event contains parameter 'nodesProperties' that is array of objects, each object has five properties:

  • azimuth: float - An azimuth of the axis of rotation in degrees in the parent's space.
  • elevation: float - An elevation of the axis of rotation in degrees in the parent's space.
  • axis: float[] - An axis of rotation in cartesian coordinates in the parent's space.
An axis of rotation in animation keys is stored in cartesian coordinates, in UI an axis of rotation is displayed in polar coordinates using azimuth and elevation.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID of the new tool instance. sIdis generated automatically if no non-empty ID is given. Note: this can be omitted, regardless of whether mSettings will be provided or not.

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: An optional map/JSON object with initial property values, aggregated objects etc. for the new tool instance.

constructor.description: Constructor for a new AxisAngleRotationTool. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

properties.description: Select coordinate system in which this tool operates. Can be Local, World, Parent, Screen or Custom

properties.description: Sets the placement mode. Can be Default, ObjectCenter, or OnScreen

properties.description: If set to true values will change in round number increments instead of continual change

properties.description: Determines if snapping when moving is enabled

properties.description: Display text box with current value, which can also be used to directly modify the value

properties.description: Determines if auto reset values mode is enabled

properties.description: Whether or not to allow context menu on right-click

properties.name: nodeSet
properties.description: Determine what set of nodes will be transformed with this tool

events.name: moving
events.description: This event will be fired when movement occurs. This event contains parameter 'nodesProperties' that is array of objects, each object has four properties: {any} node: node reference, {float[]} offsetToRest, translate relative to rest position in local coordinates {float[]} offsetToPrevious, translate relative to end position of previous sequence or rest position if no previous sequence in local coordinates {float[]} absolute, translate in parent coordinates {float[]} world, translate in world coordinates {float[]} restDifference, change of rest position translation in parent coordinates {float[]} restDifferenceInCoordinates, change of rest position translation in current coordinates

events.name: moved
events.description: This event will be fired when movement finished. This event contains parameter 'nodesProperties' that is array of objects, each object has four properties: {any} node: node reference, {float[]} offsetToRest, translate relative to rest position in local coordinates {float[]} offsetToPrevious, translate relative to end position of previous sequence or rest position if no previous sequence in local coordinates {float[]} absolute, translate in parent coordinates {float[]} world, translate in world coordinates {float[]} restDifference, change of rest position translation in parent coordinates {float[]} restDifferenceInCoordinates, change of rest position translation in current coordinates

This event contains parameter 'nodesProperties' that is array of objects, each object has five properties: {any} node: node reference, {float[]} offsetToRest, quaternion relative to rest position in parent coordinates {float[]} offsetToPrevious, euler rotation relative to end position of previous sequence, or euler rotation relative to rest position if no previous sequence in parent coordinates {float[]} absolute, quaternion in parent coordinates {float[]} world, quaternion in world coordinates {float[]} restDifference, change of rest position quaternion in parent coordinates {float[]} restDifferenceInCoordinates, change of rest position in euler rotation in current coordinates

This event contains parameter 'nodesProperties' that is array of objects, each object has five properties: {any} node: node reference, {float[]} offsetToRest, quaternion relative to rest position in parent coordinates {float[]} offsetToPrevious, euler rotation relative to end position of previous sequence, or euler rotation relative to rest position if no previous sequence in parent coordinates {float[]} absolute, quaternion in parent coordinates {float[]} world, quaternion in world coordinates {float[]} restDifference, change of rest position quaternion in parent coordinates {float[]} restDifferenceInCoordinates, change of rest position in euler rotation in current coordinates

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getCoordinateSystem coordinateSystem}. Select coordinate system in which this tool operates. Can be Local, World, Parent, Screen or Custom Default value is World.

methods.name: getEnableSnapping

returnValue.description: Value of property enableSnapping

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableSnapping enableSnapping}. Determines if snapping when rotating is enabled Default value is false.

returnValue.description: Value of property enableStepping

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.tools.ScaleTool
symbols.description: Tool to scale 3D objects

properties.name: coordinateSystem
properties.description: Select coordinate system in which this tool operates. Can be Local, World, Parent, Screen or Custom

properties.name: nonUniformScaleEnabled
properties.description: If set to true then this tool will enable scaling along a single axis, otherwise it will scale objects along all three axes proportionally

properties.name: enableStepping
properties.description: If set to true values will change in round number increments instead of continual change

properties.name: enableSnapping
properties.description: Enable snapping if set true

properties.name: showEditingUI
properties.description: Display text box with current value, which can also be used to directly modify the value

properties.name: autoResetValues
properties.description: Determines if auto reset values mode is enabled

properties.name: allowContextMenu
properties.description: Whether or not to allow context menu on right-click

properties.name: nodeSet
properties.description: Determine what set of nodes will be transformed with this tool

properties.name: placementMode
properties.description: Sets the placement mode. Can be Default, ObjectCenter, or OnScreen

events.name: scaling
events.description: This event will be fired when scaling occurs. This event contains parameter 'nodesProperties' that is array of objects, each object has four properties: {any} node: node reference, {float[]} offsetToRest, scale relative to rest position in local coordinates {float[]} offsetToPrevious, scale relative to end position of previous sequence or rest position if no previous sequence in local coordinates {float[]} absolute, scale in parent coordinates {float[]} world, scale in world coordinate {float[]} restDifference, change of rest position scale in ratio in parent coordinates {float[]} restDifferenceInCoordinates, change of rest position scale in ratio in current coordinates

events.name: scaled
events.description: This event will be fired when scaling finished. This event contains parameter 'nodesProperties' that is array of objects, each object has four properties: {any} node: node reference, {float[]} offsetToRest, scale relative to rest position in local coordinates {float[]} offsetToPrevious, scale relative to end position of previous sequence or rest position if no previous sequence in local coordinates {float[]} absolute, scale in parent coordinates {float[]} world, scale in world coordinate {float[]} restDifference, change of rest position scale in ratio in parent coordinates {float[]} restDifferenceInCoordinates, change of rest position scale in ratio in current coordinates

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.Viewer
symbols.description: Provides simple 3D visualization capability by connecting, configuring and presenting the essential Visualization Toolkit controls a single composite control.

properties.name: enableOverlay
properties.description: Enables or disables the Overlay control

properties.name: enableSceneTree
properties.description: Disables the scene tree control Button on the menu

properties.name: showSceneTree
properties.description: Shows or hides the scene tree control

properties.name: enableStepNavigation
properties.description: Disables the Step Navigation Control Button on the menu

properties.name: enableNotifications
properties.description: Disables the Message Popover Control

properties.name: showStepNavigation
properties.description: Shows or hides the Step Navigation Control

properties.name: showStepNavigationThumbnails
properties.description: Shows or hides the Step Navigation thumbnails

properties.name: overlayStepNavigation
properties.description: If enabled the Step Navigation will be overlayed on top of the viewport. Only set this during initialization. Will not work when set at runtime.

properties.name: enableToolbar
properties.description: Shows or hides Toolbar control

properties.name: enableProgressIndicator
properties.description: Enable / disable progress indicator for downloading and rendering VDS files

properties.name: showDrawerToolbar
properties.description: Shows or hides the drawer toolbar

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the Viewer control

properties.name: height
properties.description: Height of the Viewer control

properties.name: toolbarTitle
properties.description: The toolbar title

properties.name: shouldTrackVisibilityChanges
properties.description: Whether or not we want ViewStateManager to keep track of visibility changes.

properties.name: recursiveSelection
properties.description: Whether or not we want ViewStateManager to have recursive selection.

properties.name: runtimeSettings
properties.description:
Optional Emscripten runtime module settings. A JSON object with the following properties:
  • totalMemory {int} size of Emscripten module memory in bytes, default value: 512 MB.
  • logElementId {string} ID of a textarea DOM element to write the log to.
  • statusElementId {string} ID of a DOM element to write the status messages to.
Emscripten runtime module settings cannot be changed after the control is fully initialized.

properties.name: webGLContextAttributes
properties.description:
Optional WebGL context attributes. A JSON object with the following boolean properties:
  • antialias {boolean} default value true. If set to true, the context will attempt to perform antialiased rendering if possible.
  • alpha {boolean} default value true. If set to true, the context will have an alpha (transparency) channel.
  • premultipliedAlpha {boolean} default value false. If set to true, the color channels in the framebuffer will be stored premultiplied by the alpha channel to improve performance.
Other {@link https://www.khronos.org/registry/webgl/specs/latest/1.0/#5.2 WebGL context attributes} are also supported. WebGL context attributes cannot be changed after the control is fully initialized.

properties.name: showAllHotspots
properties.description: Enables or disables showing of all hotspots

properties.name: hotspotColorABGR
properties.description: Color used for highlighting Smart2D hotspots in the ABGR format.

properties.name: hotspotColor
properties.description: Color used for highlighting Smart2D hotspots in the CSS Color format.

aggregations.name: contentResources
aggregations.description: Content resources to load and display in the Viewer control.

events.description: This event will be fired when any content resource or the contentResources aggregation has been changed and processed.

events.description: This event will be fired when scene / image loaded in Viewer is about to be destroyed.

methods.name: getRuntimeSettings

returnValue.description: Value of property runtimeSettings

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getRuntimeSettings runtimeSettings}. Optional Emscripten runtime module settings. A JSON object with the following properties:
  • totalMemory {int} size of Emscripten module memory in bytes, default value: 512 MB.
  • logElementId {string} ID of a textarea DOM element to write the log to.
  • statusElementId {string} ID of a DOM element to write the status messages to.
Emscripten runtime module settings cannot be changed after the control is fully initialized. Default value is {}.

methods.name: getWebGLContextAttributes

returnValue.description: Value of property webGLContextAttributes

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getWebGLContextAttributes webGLContextAttributes}. Optional WebGL context attributes. A JSON object with the following boolean properties:
  • antialias {boolean} default value true. If set to true, the context will attempt to perform antialiased rendering if possible.
  • alpha {boolean} default value true. If set to true, the context will have an alpha (transparency) channel.
  • premultipliedAlpha {boolean} default value false. If set to true, the color channels in the framebuffer will be stored premultiplied by the alpha channel to improve performance.
Other {@link https://www.khronos.org/registry/webgl/specs/latest/1.0/#5.2 WebGL context attributes} are also supported. WebGL context attributes cannot be changed after the control is fully initialized. Default value is ...see text or source.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oRuntimeSettings
parameters.description: New value for property runtimeSettings

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getRuntimeSettings runtimeSettings}. Optional Emscripten runtime module settings. A JSON object with the following properties:
  • totalMemory {int} size of Emscripten module memory in bytes, default value: 512 MB.
  • logElementId {string} ID of a textarea DOM element to write the log to.
  • statusElementId {string} ID of a DOM element to write the status messages to.
Emscripten runtime module settings cannot be changed after the control is fully initialized. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is {}.

methods.name: setWebGLContextAttributes

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oWebGLContextAttributes
parameters.description: New value for property webGLContextAttributes

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getWebGLContextAttributes webGLContextAttributes}. Optional WebGL context attributes. A JSON object with the following boolean properties:
  • antialias {boolean} default value true. If set to true, the context will attempt to perform antialiased rendering if possible.
  • alpha {boolean} default value true. If set to true, the context will have an alpha (transparency) channel.
  • premultipliedAlpha {boolean} default value false. If set to true, the color channels in the framebuffer will be stored premultiplied by the alpha channel to improve performance.
Other {@link https://www.khronos.org/registry/webgl/specs/latest/1.0/#5.2 WebGL context attributes} are also supported. WebGL context attributes cannot be changed after the control is fully initialized. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is ...see text or source.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.ViewManager
symbols.description: An instance of the ViewManager class is responsible for tracking the current view, activating views and playing views in view groups.

associations.name: contentConnector
associations.description: An association to the {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector ContentConnector} instance that manages content resources.

associations.name: animationPlayer
associations.description:
An association to the {@link sap.ui.vk.AnimationPlayer AnimationPlayer} instance that manages animation sequences.

If no AnimationPlayer is associated with ViewManager the views can still be activated but no animation will be played.

parameters.description: A JSON-like object containing view information acquired using the {@link sap.ui.vk.Viewport#getViewInfo getViewInfo} method.

methods.description:
Sets the current scene to use the camera view information acquired from the {@link sap.ui.vk.Viewport#getViewInfo getViewInfo} method.
Internally, the setViewInfo method activates certain steps at certain animation times, and then changes the camera position, rotation and field of view (FOV) / zoom factor.

methods.name: stickySelectionHandler

parameters.name: nodes
parameters.description: Array of node references

methods.description: Helper method to provide "sticky" selection method. If this method is used then nodes are added into selection if they were not selected before, otherwise they are removed from selection. If this is called with empty nodes list then all already selected nodes are deselected.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager
symbols.description: Manages the visibility and selection states of nodes in the scene.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new ViewStateManager object. Generated automatically if no ID is given.

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new ViewStateManager object.

constructor.description: Constructor for a new ViewStateManager. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManagerBase#constructor sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManagerBase} can be used.

methods.name: enumerateOutlinedNodes

methods.name: enumerateSelection

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function to call when the selected nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type string.

methods.description: Enumerates IDs of the selected nodes.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManagerBase
symbols.description: Manages the visibility and selection states of nodes in the scene.

events.name: visibilityChanged
events.description: This event is fired when the visibility of the node changes.

events.name: selectionChanged
events.description: This event is fired when the nodes are selected/unselected.

events.name: outliningChanged
events.description: This event is fired when the nodes are outlined/unoutlined.

events.name: opacityChanged
events.description: This event is fired when opacity of the nodes is changed.

changed.name: changed
changed.description: References of nodes whose opacity changed.

opacity.name: opacity
opacity.description: Opacity assigned to the nodes. Could be either float or float[] if event was fired from a bulk operation.

events.name: tintColorChanged
events.description: This event is fired when tint color of the nodes is changed.

changed.name: changed
changed.description: References of nodes whose tint color changed.

methods.name: getContentConnector
methods.description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association {@link #getContentConnector contentConnector}, or null.

methods.name: getFeatures

returnValue.description: Value of property features

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getFeatures features}. Default value is [].

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManagerBase.

methods.name: getNodeHierarchy

returnValue.description: The node hierarchy associated with this ViewStateManagerBase object.

methods.description: Gets the NodeHierarchy object associated with this ViewStateManagerBase object.

methods.name: getOpacity

returnValue.description: A single value or an array of values. Value null means that the node's own opacity should be used.

parameters.name: nodeRefs
parameters.description: The node reference or the array of node references.

methods.description:
Gets the opacity of the node. If a single node reference is passed to the method then a single value is returned.
If an array of node references is passed to the method then an array of values is returned.

methods.name: getOutlineColor

returnValue.description: A single value or an array of values. Value null means that the node's own tint color should be used.

parameters.name: inABGRFormat
parameters.description: This flag indicates to return the outline color in the ABGR format, if it equals false then the color is returned in the CSS color format.

methods.description: Gets the outline color

methods.name: getOutlineWidth

returnValue.description: width of outline

methods.description: Gets the outline width

methods.name: getOutliningState

returnValue.description: A single value or an array of values where the value is true if the node is outlined, false otherwise.

parameters.name: nodeRefs
parameters.description: The node reference or the array of node references.

methods.description:
Gets the outlining state of the node. If a single node reference is passed to the method then a single outlining state is returned.
If an array of node references is passed to the method then an array of outlining states is returned.

methods.description:
Gets the selectable property of the nodes. Selectable nodes can be selected in the viewport by mouse click or by using a selection tool. This property does not affect rendering. By default nodes are selectable. If a single node reference is passed to the method then a single value is returned.
If an array of node references is passed to the method then an array of values is returned.

experimental.text: This method is experimental and might be modified or removed in future versions.

methods.name: setSelectable

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: nodeRefs
parameters.description: The node reference or the array of node references.

parameters.name: selectable
parameters.description: The new value of the selectable property. If null is passed then the selectable property is reset and the value of the node's own selectable property is in use.

methods.description: Sets the selectable property of the nodes. Selectable nodes can be selected in the viewport by mouse click or by using a selection tool. This property does not affect rendering. By default nodes are selectable. If a grouping node is unselectable then all its descendant nodes are unselectable too. If a grouping node is selectable then its descendants can be either selectable or unselectable based on their selectable property.

experimental.text: This method is experimental and might be modified or removed in future versions.
